definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: And he said unto me, Go in, and behold the wicked abominations that they do here.
sentences.chinese: 他说，你进去，看他们在这里所行可憎的恶事。

sentences.english: The most odious of all oppressions are those which mask as justice.
sentences.chinese: 最可憎的压制总是戴着正义的面具。

sentences.english: If anyone turns a deaf ear to the law, even his prayers are detestable.
sentences.chinese: 转耳不听律法的，他的祈祷也为可憎。

sentences.english: A walk-in closet for all her heinous shoes she can’t even afford?
sentences.chinese: 一间装满那些她都负担不起的可憎鞋子的衣帽间？

sentences.english: Toads and snakes are repulsive to many people.
sentences.chinese: 许多人觉得瘌蛤蟆和蛇可憎。

sentences.english: Should not be stepped into a pile of sticky wet slurry heinous.
sentences.chinese: 也不要被踩成一堆黏湿可憎的稀泥。

sentences.english: And , somehow or other , loveliness is infernally sad .
sentences.chinese: 于是乎，可爱竟令人感到有些许可憎的悲伤。

sentences.english: And they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things thereof and all the abominations thereof from thence.
sentences.chinese: 他们必到那里，也必从其中除掉一切可憎可厌的物。

sentences.english: But they set their abominations in the house, which is called by my name, to defile it.
sentences.chinese: 竟把可憎之物设立在称为我名下的殿中，污秽了这殿。

sentences.english: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
sentences.chinese: 何况那可憎又腐败，喝罪孽如同喝水的世人呢？

sentences.english: He said also unto me, Turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see greater abominations that they do.
sentences.chinese: 他又说，你还要看见他们另外行大可憎的事。

sentences.english: His common sense would have dismissed that as repulsive and vulgar.
sentences.chinese: 他的常识本会以可憎和低俗为由予以排斥这一思想的。

sentences.english: The sacrifice of the wicked is detestable- how much more so when brought with evil intent!
sentences.chinese: 恶人的祭物是可憎的，何况他存恶意来献呢。

sentences.english: We should recognize that the body is undesirable. So we must self-reflect and be fearful.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该要知道可憎，这是一个非常可憎厌的东西。

sentences.english: And his wife's face, too, struck him as repulsive and hateful.
sentences.chinese: 此刻他连妻子也感到面目可憎，令人讨厌。

sentences.english: When they came to besiege Kir Haraseth, Mesha did an abominable thing.
sentences.chinese: 当他们来围攻吉珥哈列设时，米沙做了一件可憎的事。

definition: to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]
